qas.question: Around when did Presbyterian missionaries arrived in New Mexico?
The established Presbyterian church in New Mexico provided an alternative to which religion?
Who brought Catholicism into New Mexico?
In which century did New Mexican missionaries establish a presence in southern United States?

plausible_answers.text: modernize and make efforts at winning the converts back

qas.question: When the Catholic church arrived, it caused the United States to do what?
How many converts refused to return to the church?
Which churches can no longer be found in the area?
Who brought Catholicism to the United States?

context: In the <b3_0>late <a0_0>1800s<b3_0/><a0_0/>, Presbyterian missionaries established a presence in what is now northern New Mexico. This provided an alternative to the <a1_0>Catholicism<a1_0/>, which was brought to the area by the <a2_0><b7_0>Spanish Conquistadors<b7_0/><a2_0/> and had remained unchanged. The area experienced a "mini" reformation, in that many converts were made to Presbyterianism, prompting persecution. In some cases, the converts left towns and villages to establish their own neighboring villages. The arrival of the United States to the area prompted the Catholic church to <b4_0>modernize and make efforts at winning the converts back<b4_0/>, <b5_0>many<b5_0/> of which did return. However, there are still <b6_0>stalwart Presbyterians and Presbyterian churches<b6_0/> in the area.
